channel.title: Why Whonix KVM need dnsmasq?
channel.description:
Hello. I am using Whonix KVM. The host OS is Debian 11. I would like to set up DNS over TLS on my host OS, but dnsmasq occupying port 53 and is interfering with the set up. Is there any problem to disable the DNS server by setting `port=0` in dnsmasq? I am planning to set up DNS over TLS with systemd-resolved.
For now, I have set up DNS over TLS by forwarding to unbound with the following settings. **/etc/resolv.conf** ``` nameserver 127.0.0.1 ``` **/etc/dnsmasq.conf** ``` no-resolv server=127.0.0.1#5353 ``` **/etc/unbound/unbound.conf** ``` server: interface: 127.0.0.1 port: 5353 ```

For now, I have set up DNS over TLS by forwarding to unbound with the following settings.

server:
    interface: 127.0.0.1
